notesStmt.note: The following are responsible for particular readings or for changes to this file, as noted: Matthew Bosley

bibl.title: The Medical and Surgical History of the War of the Rebellion. (1861-65.)

taxonomy.bibl: Medical and Surgical History of the War of the Rebellion

keywords.term: contusion of abdomen from fragment of shell

revisionDesc.change: copied case from MSHWR, added proofing of transcription and encoding, identified keyword terms

body.p: CASE 115.—Private J. Robbins, Co. G, 119th Pennsylvania, received, at the Wilderness, May 14, 1864, a severe contusion of the abdomen from a fragment of shell. Extreme depression followed, from which he slowly rallied. Opiates were administered. There was extreme tenderness in the region of the liver, and jaundice. The patient was treated on a hospital transport steamer and conveyed to Alexandria, where he died on May 28, 1864.
